column4: is your model listed here? http://mxhaard.free.fr/spca5xx.html
having trouble with a logitech webcam here. how did you load gspca? every time i plug in, uvcvideo gets loaded.
i either use the precompiled gscpa modules for my current kernel or the gspca sources (and compile them against the kernel with module-assistent)
i have gspca compiled and installed. but when I plug the cam in, it loads uvcvideo instead
strange. on my machine uvcvideo is not loaded at all
gscpa uses videodev, v4l2_common and v4l1_compat
which logitech cam do you have ? mine is a logitech quickcam notebook pro.
did you tried to blacklist uvcvideo in /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.local?
didn't know about that, let me try it...
the format is "blacklist uvcvideo". by the way i have blacklisted "snd_usb_audio"
my model is some sort of quickcam also. but can't remember which exactly
lsusb says "046d:08c3" for mine, what's yours? (trying blacklisting now)
either 046d:08ad or  046d:c046 (i have webcam and mouse from logitech and cannot tell which is which because lsusb shows both of them as "Logitech, Inc.")
thanks, gspca isn't working for me -- no device.
Yes, bridge is spca525a, driver is linux-UVC. Does that mean I should be using uvcvideo?
ok, thanks, i'll re-try uvcvideo, which did work better than GSPCA in that it at least created a device for me.
giving up on this webcam, will just buy a new one.
sorry to hear this. it's listed as supported...
